00048 /**************************************************************************\
00049  *
00050  *  File: epilogue_merge.c
00051  *
00052  *  Description: Epilogue merge
00053  *
00054  *  Modified:
00055  *

00057 /* 09/17/02 REK Updating to use functions from libtahoeop instead of Tmdes */
00058 
00059 /* 10/29/02 REK Adding config.h */
00060 #include <config.h>
00061 #include "mia_internal.h"
00062 
00063 extern int O_is_caller_save_predicate (L_Operand * pred);
00064 
00065 /* #define EPILOGUE_DEBUG */
00066 
00067 /* Possibly replace predicated branch with epilogue code */
00068 #define MERGE_PREDICATED_RET_BR 1       /* 0 = no, 1 = yes */
00069 
00070 /* Merge epilogue if opers_in_merge_space/epi_cb_opers> threshold */
00071 /* Figure that if there is lots of instrs, there is lots of space */
00072 #define EPILOGUE_MERGE_THRESHOLD 2.0
00073 #define EPILOGUE_MERGE_MIN_OPERS 2
00074 
00075 static L_Cb *
00076 Find_epilogue_cb (L_Func * fn, int *size_of_cb)
00077 {
00078   L_Cb *cb;
00079   L_Oper *oper;
00080   int count;
00081 
00082   for (cb = fn->last_cb; cb; cb = cb->prev_cb)
00083     {
00084       if (L_EXTRACT_BIT_VAL (cb->flags, L_CB_EPILOGUE))
00085         {
00086           count = 0;
00087           for (oper = cb->first_op; oper; oper = oper->next_op)
00088             {
00089               if (!LT_is_non_instr (oper))
00090                 count++;
00091             }                   /* for oper */
00092           *size_of_cb = count;
00093           return (cb);
00094         }                       /* if */
00095     }                           /* for cb */
00096   L_punt ("Find_epilogue_cb: Epilogue cb not found\n");
00097   return (NULL);
00098 }                               /* Find_epilogue_cb */
00099 
00100 
00101 /****************************************************************************
00102  *
00103  * routine: Count_opers_in_merge_space()
00104  * purpose: This function counts the number of opers between the given op and
00105  *          the first previous op which satisfies one of these conditions:
00106  *                1) the top of the block is reached,
00107  *                2) a previous branch is found,
00108  *                3) the defining compare of the predicate on the supplied
00109  *                   branch op if one is given.
00110  * input: cb - cb to count ops in
00111  *        branch_oper - If NULL, it is assumed that the cb does not end in
00112  *                      a branch and ops are counted from the end of the cb.
00113  *                      Otherwise, this is the branch which conditionally or
00114  *                      uncondtionally jumps to the epilogue.
00115  * output:
00116  * returns:
00117  * modified:
00118  * note:
00119  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00120 
00121 static int
00122 Count_opers_in_merge_space (L_Cb * cb, L_Oper * branch_oper)
00123 {
00124   L_Oper *op;
00125   L_Oper *last_op;
00126   L_Operand *qp_operand;
00127   unsigned int count;
00128 
00129   if (branch_oper)
00130     {
00131       qp_operand = branch_oper->pred[0];
00132       last_op = branch_oper->prev_op;
00133     }                           /* if */
00134   else
00135     {
00136       qp_operand = NULL;
00137       last_op = cb->last_op;
00138     }                           /* else */
00139 
00140   /* Stop count because branch will halt code movement */
00141   /* Stop count because compare's dest is qualifying predicate */
00142 
00143   count = 0;
00144   for (op = last_op;
00145        op && !LT_is_call_br (op) && !LT_is_cond_br (op) &&
00146        !(qp_operand && LT_is_cmp_op (op) &&
00147          L_is_dest_operand (qp_operand, op)); op = op->prev_op)
00148     {
00149       count++;
00150     }                           /* for op */
00151 
00152   return (count);
00153 }                               /* Count_opers_in_merge_space */
00154 
00155 static void
00156 Rev_copy_prop_return_value (L_Func * fn, Set modified_cbs)
00157 {
00158   L_Cb *cb;
00159   L_Oper *oper, *last_ret_val_def_oper;
00160   int delete_ret_oper;
00161   L_Operand *replace_operand;
00162 
00163   for (cb = fn->first_cb; cb; cb = cb->next_cb)
00164     {
00165       /* Do optimization only over cbs changed by epilogue merge */
00166       if (Set_in (modified_cbs, cb->id))
00167         {
00168           last_ret_val_def_oper = NULL;
00169           for (oper = cb->last_op; oper; oper = oper->prev_op)
00170             {
00171               if (L_subroutine_call_opcode (oper))
00172                 break;
00173 
00174               if (!(L_move_opcode (oper)))
00175                 continue;
00176 
00177               if (!((L_is_macro (oper->dest[0])) &&
00178                     (oper->dest[0]->value.mac == L_MAC_P16)))
00179                 continue;
00180 
00181               last_ret_val_def_oper = oper;
00182               break;
00183             }                   /* for oper */
00184 
00185           /* ret value move found, try to do reverse copy prop, ie. 
00186              oper A     op z = x,y
00187              oper B     move P16 = z
00188 
00189              Right now very limited - will only do it if oper A is
00190              unpredicated or if z is used as a source operand between
00191              A and B */
00192 
00193           if (last_ret_val_def_oper)
00194             {
00195               replace_operand = last_ret_val_def_oper->src[0];
00196               delete_ret_oper = FALSE;
00197 
00198               for (oper = last_ret_val_def_oper; oper; oper = oper->prev_op)
00199                 {
00200                   /* Can't substitute above a jsr */
00201                   if (L_subroutine_call_opcode (oper))
00202                     break;
00203 
00204                   if (L_is_src_operand (replace_operand, oper))
00205                     break;
00206 
00207                   if (L_is_dest_operand (replace_operand, oper))
00208                     {
00209                       /* Only do substitution if not predicated */
00210                       if (oper->pred[0] == NULL)
00211                         {
00212                           L_delete_operand (oper->dest[0]);
00213                           L_copy_operand (replace_operand);
00214                           delete_ret_oper = TRUE;
00215                         }       /* if */
00216                       break;
00217                     }           /* if */
00218                 }               /* for oper */
00219 
00220               if (delete_ret_oper)
00221                 L_delete_oper (cb, last_ret_val_def_oper);
00222             }                   /* if */
00223         }                       /* if */
00224     }                           /* for cb */
00225 }                               /* Rev_copy_prop_return_value */
00226 
00227 void
00228 Mopti_epilogue_merge (L_Func * fn)
00229 {
00230   L_Cb *epilogue_cb, *rts_cb;
00231   L_Cb *src_cb;
00232   L_Oper *after_oper, *br_oper, *oper, *new_oper;
00233   L_Operand *predicate;
00234   L_Flow *flow, *epilogue_flow, hack_flow;
00235   int can_remove_epilogue_cb;
00236   int epilogue_cb_opers, opers_in_merge_space;
00237   float oper_ratio;
00238   Set modified_cbs;
00239 
00240   can_remove_epilogue_cb = TRUE;
00241   modified_cbs = NULL;
00242   epilogue_cb = Find_epilogue_cb (fn, &epilogue_cb_opers);
00243 
00244   rts_cb = L_new_cb (++L_fn->max_cb_id);
00245   L_insert_cb_after (fn, epilogue_cb, rts_cb);
00246   rts_cb->attr =
00247     L_concat_attr (rts_cb->attr, L_new_attr ("DEAD-EPILOGUE", 0));
00248   rts_cb->flags |= L_CB_EPILOGUE;
00249   /* copy the epilogue operations into this new rts-only cb */
00250   for (oper = epilogue_cb->first_op; oper; oper = oper->next_op)
00251     {
00252       if (LT_is_non_instr (oper))
00253         continue;
00254       if (!L_subroutine_return_opcode (oper))
00255         {
00256           if (oper->dest[0] && oper->dest[0]->type == L_OPERAND_MACRO)
00257             {
00258               new_oper = L_create_new_op (Lop_DEFINE);
00259               new_oper->src[0] = L_copy_operand (oper->dest[0]);
00260               L_insert_oper_after (rts_cb, rts_cb->last_op, new_oper);
00261             }                   /* if */
00262         }                       /* if */
00263       else
00264         {
00265           new_oper = L_copy_operation (oper);
00266           L_insert_oper_after (rts_cb, rts_cb->last_op, new_oper);
00267         }                       /* else */
00268     }                           /* for oper */
00269 
00270   for (flow = epilogue_cb->src_flow; flow; flow = flow->next_flow)
00271     {
00272       src_cb = flow->src_cb;
00273 
00274       /* don't merge epilogue into kernel of modulo scheduled loop */
00275       if (L_EXTRACT_BIT_VAL (src_cb->flags, L_CB_SOFTPIPE))
00276         {
00277           can_remove_epilogue_cb = FALSE;
00278           continue;
00279         }                       /* if */
00280 
00281       epilogue_flow =
00282         (L_Flow *) L_find_complement_flow (src_cb->dest_flow, flow);
00283 
00284       br_oper = L_find_branch_for_flow (src_cb, epilogue_flow);
00285 
00286       if (br_oper)
00287         {
00288           /* branch to epilogue */
00289           after_oper = br_oper->prev_op;
00290           opers_in_merge_space = Count_opers_in_merge_space (src_cb, br_oper);
00291 
00292 #ifdef EPILOGUE_DEBUG
00293           fprintf (stderr,
00294                    "Branch op %d in cb %d (%d ops) to epilogue cb %d "
00295                    "(%d ops)\n",
00296                    br_oper->id, src_cb->id, opers_in_merge_space,
00297                    epilogue_cb->id, epilogue_cb_opers);
00298 #endif
00299           predicate = br_oper->pred[0];
00300           if (predicate)
00301             {
00302 #if !MERGE_PREDICATED_RET_BR
00303               /* do not do epilogue merge into a cb that has a conditional
00304                  branch to the epilogue block. */
00305               can_remove_epilogue_cb = FALSE;
00306 #ifdef EPILOGUE_DEBUG
00307               fprintf (stderr, "   Never merging to conditional branches\n");
00308 #endif
00309               continue;
00310 #else
00311               /* First determine if the predicate on the branch is a caller
00312                  save predicate.  If so, there is no problem.  If not, then
00313                  we must check the epilogue code for a restore of pr.  This
00314                  pr restore and the return cannot be guarded by a callee
00315                  save predicate since the value of the predicate will
00316                  change. */
00317 
00318               if (!O_is_caller_save_predicate (predicate))
00319                 {
00320                   /* check for mov pr = rX, mask */
00321                   for (oper = epilogue_cb->first_op; oper;
00322                        oper = oper->next_op)
00323                     {
00324                       if (L_is_macro (oper->dest[0]) &&
00325                           (oper->dest[0]->value.mac == TAHOE_PRED_BLK_REG))
00326                         break;
00327                     }           /* for oper */
00328 
00329                   if (oper)
00330                     {
00331                       /* above loop must have terminated from break */
00332                       can_remove_epilogue_cb = FALSE;
00333                       continue;
00334                     }           /* if */
00335                 }               /* if */
00336 
00337               /* estimate if it is profitable to merge. */
00338 
00339               oper_ratio = opers_in_merge_space / epilogue_cb_opers;
00340               if ((epilogue_cb_opers < EPILOGUE_MERGE_MIN_OPERS) ||
00341                   (oper_ratio >= EPILOGUE_MERGE_THRESHOLD))
00342                 {
00343 #ifdef EPILOGUE_DEBUG
00344                   fprintf (stderr, "Predicated merge after oper %d "
00345                            "(ratio = %4.2f)\n", after_oper->id, oper_ratio);
00346 #endif
00347                 }               /* if */
00348               else
00349                 {
00350 #ifdef EPILOGUE_DEBUG
00351                   fprintf (stderr,
00352                            "Not merging after oper %d (ratio = %4.2f)\n",
00353                            after_oper->id, oper_ratio);
00354 #endif
00355                   can_remove_epilogue_cb = FALSE;
00356                   continue;
00357                 }               /* else */
00358 #endif
00359             }                   /* if */
00360           else
00361             {
00362 #ifdef EPILOGUE_DEBUG
00363               /* no predicate on the branch.  It is a jump to the
00364                  epilogue. */
00365               fprintf (stderr, "Jump op %d in cb %d to epilogue cb %d "
00366                        "(%d ops)\n",
00367                        br_oper->id, src_cb->id, epilogue_cb->id,
00368                        epilogue_cb_opers);
00369 #endif
00370             }                   /* else */
00371         }                       /* if */
00372       else
00373         {
00374           /* fall thru to epilogue */
00375           predicate = NULL;
00376           after_oper = src_cb->last_op;
00377           /* Delete this flow */
00378           hack_flow.next_flow = flow->next_flow;
00379           src_cb->dest_flow =
00380             L_delete_flow (src_cb->dest_flow, epilogue_flow);
00381           epilogue_cb->src_flow = L_delete_flow (epilogue_cb->src_flow, flow);
00382           flow = &hack_flow;
00383 
00384 #ifdef EPILOGUE_DEBUG
00385           fprintf (stderr, "Fall thru cb %d to epilogue cb %d "
00386                    "(%d ops)\n",
00387                    src_cb->id, epilogue_cb->id, epilogue_cb_opers);
00388 #endif
00389         }                       /* else */
00390 
00391       modified_cbs = Set_add (modified_cbs, src_cb->id);
00392 
00393 #ifdef EPILOGUE_DEBUG
00394       fprintf (stderr, "   Copy epilogue ops after op %d in cb %d\n",
00395                after_oper->id, src_cb->id);
00396 #endif
00397       for (oper = epilogue_cb->first_op; oper; oper = oper->next_op)
00398         {
00399 
00400           if (LT_is_non_instr (oper))
00401             continue;
00402 
00403           if (IS_PREDICATED (oper))
00404             L_punt ("Mopti_epilogue_merge: Epilogue cb oper %d has a "
00405                     "predicate\n", oper->id);
00406 
00407             /*** CHAD: If this oper is a return, and br_oper!=NULL, then
00408                  don't copy this instruction... instead, tag the branch
00409                  to be converted during phase 3! ****/
00410 
00411           if ((br_oper) && L_subroutine_return_opcode (oper))
00412             {
00413               /* add the "cvt to rts" attrib */
00414               br_oper->attr =
00415                 L_concat_attr (br_oper->attr, L_new_attr ("TO-RTS", 0));
00416               epilogue_flow->dst_cb = rts_cb;
00417               /* delete this flow */
00418               hack_flow.next_flow = flow->next_flow;
00419               epilogue_cb->src_flow =
00420                 L_delete_flow (epilogue_cb->src_flow, flow);
00421               flow = &hack_flow;
00422               br_oper->src[0]->value.cb = rts_cb;
00423               after_oper = br_oper;
00424               continue;
00425             }                   /* if */
00426 
00427             /*** END CHAD ***/
00428 
00429           new_oper = L_copy_operation (oper);
00430           new_oper->pred[0] = L_copy_operand (predicate);
00431           L_insert_oper_after (src_cb, after_oper, new_oper);
00432           after_oper = new_oper;
00433         }                       /* for oper */
00434       src_cb->flags |= epilogue_cb->flags;
00435     }                           /* for flow */
00436 
00437   if (can_remove_epilogue_cb)
00438     L_delete_cb (fn, epilogue_cb);
00439 
00440   Rev_copy_prop_return_value (fn, modified_cbs);
00441   Set_dispose (modified_cbs);
00442 
00443   L_rebuild_src_flow (fn);
00444 }                               /* Mopti_epilogue_merge */
00445 
00446 void
00447 Mopti_epilogue_cleanup (L_Func * fn)
00448 {
00449   /* check each branch oper for the "TO-RTS" attrib, 
00450      replace it as an RTS instruction and delete its flow */
00451 
00452   L_Cb *cb, *epilogue_cb;
00453   L_Oper *op, *rts_op;
00454 
00455   /* fprintf(stderr, "\nepilogue cleanup!\n"); */
00456 
00457   for (epilogue_cb = fn->last_cb; epilogue_cb;
00458        epilogue_cb = epilogue_cb->prev_cb)
00459     if (L_find_attr (epilogue_cb->attr, "DEAD-EPILOGUE"))
00460       break;
00461 
00462   if (!epilogue_cb)
00463     {
00464       fprintf (stderr,
00465                "Warning - epilogue_cleanup() - no epilogue cb was found!\n");
00466       return;
00467     }                           /* if */
00468 
00469   for (rts_op = epilogue_cb->last_op;
00470        (rts_op != NULL) && (!L_subroutine_return_opcode (rts_op));
00471        rts_op = rts_op->prev_op);
00472 
00473   if (!rts_op)
00474     {
00475       fprintf (stderr, "Warning - no rts found in epilogue cb %d!\n",
00476                epilogue_cb->id);
00477       return;
00478     }                           /* if */
00479 
00480   for (cb = fn->first_cb; cb; cb = cb->next_cb)
00481     for (op = cb->first_op; op; op = op->next_op)
00482       {
00483         L_Oper *copy_rts;
00484         L_Flow *br_flow;
00485         L_Attr *isl_attr;
00486         if (NULL == L_find_attr (op->attr, "TO-RTS"))
00487           continue;
00488 
00489         /* convert op to an rts */
00490         /* fprintf(stderr, "RTS'ing oper %d\n",op->id); */
00491         copy_rts = L_copy_operation (rts_op);
00492         if (op->pred[0])
00493           copy_rts->pred[0] = L_copy_operand (op->pred[0]);
00494         L_insert_oper_after (cb, op, copy_rts);
00495 
00496         /* fprintf(stderr, "new oper = %d\n",op->next_op->id); */
00497         isl_attr = L_find_attr (copy_rts->attr, "isl");
00498         if (isl_attr)
00499           copy_rts->attr = L_delete_attr (copy_rts->attr, isl_attr);
00500 
00501         isl_attr = L_find_attr (op->attr, "isl");
00502         if (isl_attr)
00503           copy_rts->attr =
00504             L_concat_attr (copy_rts->attr, L_copy_attr (isl_attr));
00505 
00506         br_flow = L_find_flow_for_branch (cb, op);
00507         if (!br_flow)
00508           {
00509             fprintf (stderr, "Warning! Epilogue cleanup cannot find"
00510                      " branch flow!\n");
00511             continue;
00512           }                     /* if */
00513 
00514         cb->dest_flow = L_delete_flow (cb->dest_flow, br_flow);
00515 
00516         L_delete_oper (cb, op);
00517         op = copy_rts;
00518       }                         /* for op */
00519 
00520   L_delete_cb (fn, epilogue_cb);
00521 }                               /* Mopti_epilogue_cleanup */
Generated on Sat Aug 30 18:02:29 2014 for libiamopti by  1.4.7
